entry.title: Direct Connect and Hybrid Connectivity with Equinix

link.title: Direct Connect and Hybrid Connectivity with Equinix

entry.content:
2 May 2024

Direct Connect and Hybrid Connectivity with Equinix

Hosts:
Riggs Goodman III

Guests:
Equinix Team

Abstract:
Equinix is joining us for the Routing Loop this week. In this session, we will dive deep into the capabilities Equinix provides as a AWS Direct Connect partner to provide connectivity for hybrid workloads. In addition, we will have the Direct Connect Product Manager with us to discuss new capabilities we recently launched with DX

Session hasn't started. Join live on 2 May 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: Securing your applications against web threats with AWS WAF

link.title: Securing your applications against web threats with AWS WAF

entry.content:
24 April 2024

Securing your applications against web threats with AWS WAF

Hosts:
Sidhartha Chauhan

Guests:
Oleksandr Golovatyi, Sr Technical Account Manager
Sagar Desarda, US Tech Leader, Edge-Services

Abstract:
AWS WAF provides a multitude of capabilities for protecting your internet-facing applications. In this session, learn how applications fronted by Amazon CloudFront, Application Load Balancer, Amazon API Gateway, and other AWS services can be protected through seamless integration with AWS WAF. Get additional insights into AWS WAF configuration best practices to help secure your application at an optimal cost.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Ingress inspection architectures on AWS
entry.content:
18 April 2024

Ingress inspection architectures on AWS

Hosts:
Alex Huides

Guests:
Tom Adamski, Principal SA, Networking

Abstract:
Join to learn about different firewall deployments for your Internet facing applications. We'll cover network inspection basics and patterns for deployment of AWS WAF, AWS Network Firewall and 3rd party appliances. Expect a demo - time permitting.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Network Security Protections for LLMs
entry.content:
11 April 2024

Network Security Protections for LLMs

Hosts:
Riggs Goodman III

Guests:
Adam Boeglin, Principal SA, ML Infrastructure
Alan Erdley, Principal Edge GTM Specialist
EJ Chen, Sr Solutions Architect, Edge
Justin Kurpius, Sr Edge Specialist

Abstract:
Large Language Models are top of mind for many customers of AWS with the development of Gen AI applications. However, managing the applications applications against unwanted traffic can result in increased costs. In this Routing Loop Session, we will dive into the affects of bot traffic on LLM applications, the impact to costs, and how you can provide network layer security capabilities using AWS WAF and Amazon CloudFront to mitigate this traffic. At the end, we will dive into the different AWS chipsets that support these workloads, including AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Egress inspection architectures with AWS Network Firewall

link.title: Egress inspection architectures with AWS Network Firewall

entry.content:
4 April 2024

Egress inspection architectures with AWS Network Firewall

Hosts:
Tom Adamski

Guests:

Abstract:
Join to learn about egress network deployment models with AWS Network Firewall and how to control TLS encrypted traffic. Session will include a hands-on demo of ANF TLS inspection capabilities.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Generative AI with AWS Networking
entry.content:
28 March 2024

Generative AI with AWS Networking

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel,

Guests:
Du'An Lightfoot, Sr. Developer Advocate
Sidhartha Chauhan, Principal Solutions Architect

Abstract:
In this session we talk about AWS GenAI capabilities. We also have a discussion on how this can be applied to networking logs, CFN rollouts and troubleshooting, and the art of the possible for the AWS networking space.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Introducing mTLS on Application Load Balancer with a live demonstration

link.title: Introducing mTLS on Application Load Balancer with a live demonstration

entry.content:
21 March 2024

Introducing mTLS on Application Load Balancer with a live demonstration

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel

Guests:
William Wang, Sr. Product Manager
Ankit Chadha, Sr Networking Solutions Architect

Abstract:
In this session we will talk about the recently released ALB feature mTLS. We will demonstrate how to enable this feature, talk about how to maintain the trust store, and how to implement this in existing workloads.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Traffic Inspection with AWS Cloud WAN

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Traffic Inspection with AWS Cloud WAN

entry.content:
29 February 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Traffic Inspection with AWS Cloud WAN

Hosts:
Sidhartha Chauhan

Guests:
Pratik Mankad, Senior SA, Networking

Abstract:
AWS Cloud WAN connects your branch offices, data centers, and Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (Amazon VPCs), helping you build a global network with a few clicks. In this chalk talk, explore architecture models for inspecting ingress, egress, and east-west traffic when using AWS Cloud WAN.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting multicloud and hybrid networks

link.title: re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting multicloud and hybrid networks

entry.content:
22 February 2024

re:Invent 2023 Chalk Talk - Connecting multicloud and hybrid networks

Hosts:
Matt Lehwess

Guests:
James Devine, Principal SA
Alexis Marcou, Senior SA

Abstract:
There is additional complexity to consider when connecting your network with other cloud providers, your on-premises network, or resources in a collocation facility. In this chalk talk, learn common patterns for multicloud and hybrid connectivity using AWS Direct Connect, AWS Cloud WAN, AWS Transit Gateway, AWS Site-to-Site VPN, or SD-WAN devices. Based on your questions, the talk will introduce real-world use cases and best practices.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions
